com.viaoa.ds
Class OADataSource

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.ds.OADataSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
OADataSourceAuto, OADataSourceClient, OADataSourceJDBC
public abstract class OADataSource
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class used for defining sources for Object storage.
A dataSource can be anything, including Relational Databases, XML data, legacy database, persistent data storage, etc.

There are methods defined for updating, deleting, and using Queries to retreive Objects. Queries are based on the structure of Objects and not on the structure of the physical dataSource.

The OAObject and Hub Collections have methods to automatically and naturally work with dataSources, without requiring any direct access to dataSource methods.

OADataSource has static methods that are used to manage all created OADataSources. Subclasses of OADataSource register themselves with the static OADataSource so that they can be found and used by Objects based on the Object Class, without requiring direct access to the OADataSource object.

For more information about this package, see documentation.

See Also:
getDataSource(Class), OASelect

updateMany2ManyLinks

public abstract void updateMany2ManyLinks(OAObject masterObject,
                                          OAObject[] adds,
                                          OAObject[] removes,
                                          java.lang.String propFromMaster)
Used by dataSources to update special requirements for handling Many2Many relationships (ex:Link Table).

Uses the hub.masterObject, Hub.getRemovedObjects(), Hub.getAddedObjects() to find out which objects were added or removed.
This is called by OAObject.cascadeSave/Delete methods

insert

public abstract void insert(OAObject obj)
Add/Insert a new Object into DataSource.

Called directly by OAObject.save()

Parameters:
bForce - is true, then object should be inserted without verifying.
See Also:
OAObject.save()

insertWithoutReferences

public abstract void insertWithoutReferences(OAObject obj)
Add/Insert a new Object into DataSource, without references (fkeys).

Called directly by OAObject.saveWithoutReferences() to save a reference while saving another Object.

See Also:
OAObject.save()

public abstract void delete(OAObject obj)

save

public void save(OAObject obj)
Used to save an object to DataSource.

If object is an OAObject, then update() or insert() will be called, else nothing is done.

See Also:
insert(com.viaoa.object.OAObject), update(com.viaoa.object.OAObject, java.lang.String[], java.lang.String[])

                          java.lang.String extraWhere,
                          java.lang.Object[] params,

Parameters:
selectClass - Class to perform query on
whereObject - parent object that is used to build where clause for
extraWhere - additional where query to add (using AND) to query string.
propertyNameFromMaster - name of property from where Object.

select

public abstract java.util.Iterator select(java.lang.Class selectClass,
                                          java.lang.String queryWhere,
                                          java.lang.String queryOrder,
                                          int max)
Perform a query to retrieve objects from DataSource.

See OASelect for complete description on selects/queriess.

Parameters:
selectClass - Class of object to create and return
queryWhere - query String using property paths based on Object structure. DataSource will convert query to native query language of the datasoure.
Returns:
Iterator that is used to return objects of type selectClass

selectPassthru

public java.util.Iterator selectPassthru(java.lang.Class selectClass,
                                         java.lang.String query)

selectPassthru

public abstract java.util.Iterator selectPassthru(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                  java.lang.String queryWhere,
                                                  java.lang.String queryOrder,
                                                  int max)
Performs a select using native query language for DataSource.

queryWhere should include everything including "FROM", and "WHERE". The selected columns will be done automatically.
"ORDER BY" will be supplied if queryOrder exists.

Parameters:
selectClass - Class of object to create and return
query - query based on DataSource structure.
Returns:
Iterator that is used to return objects of type selectClass
See Also:
OASelect

selectPassthru

public java.util.Iterator selectPassthru(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                         java.lang.String queryWhere,
                                         java.lang.String queryOrder)

public abstract java.lang.Object execute(java.lang.String command)
Execute a command on the dataSource.

Parameters:

select

public abstract java.util.Iterator select(java.lang.Class selectClass,
                                          OAObject whereObject,
                                          java.lang.String extraWhere,
                                          java.lang.Object[] args,
                                          java.lang.String propertyNameFromMaster,
                                          java.lang.String queryOrder,
                                          int max)
Perform a query based on a where object to retrieve objects from DataSource.

See OASelect for complete description on selects/queriess.

Parameters:
selectClass - Class of object to create and return
whereObject - parent object that is used to build where clause for. Uses convertToString()
extraWhere - query String using property paths based on Object structure. DataSource
queryOrder - comma separated list of property paths for sorting. "DESC" or "ASC" can be used to determin descending or ascending order. will convert query to native query language of the datasoure.
propertyNameFromMaster - name of property from where object.
Returns:
Iterator that is used to return objects of type selectClass
See Also:
#convertToString(String,Object), OASelect

select

public java.util.Iterator select(java.lang.Class selectClass,
                                 OAObject whereObject,
                                 java.lang.String extraWhere,
                                 java.lang.Object[] args,
                                 java.lang.String propertyNameFromMaster,
                                 java.lang.String queryOrder)

select

public abstract java.util.Iterator select(java.lang.Class selectClass,
                                          OAObject whereObject,
                                          java.lang.String propertyNameFromMaster,
                                          java.lang.String queryOrder,
                                          int max)
Perform a query based on a where object to retrieve objects from DataSource.

See OASelect for complete description on selects/queriess.

Parameters:
selectClass - Class of object to create and return
whereObject - parent object that is used to build where clause for. Uses convertToString()
extraWhere - query String using property paths based on Object structure. DataSource
queryOrder - comma separated list of property paths for sorting. "DESC" or "ASC" can be used to determin descending or ascending order. will convert query to native query language of the datasoure.
propertyNameFromMaster - name of property from where object.
Returns:
Iterator that is used to return objects of type selectClass
See Also:
#convertToString(String,Object), OASelect

willCreatePropertyValue

public boolean willCreatePropertyValue(OAObject object,
                                       java.lang.String propertyName)
Returns true if the dataSource will set the property value before saving.

getAllowIdChange

public boolean getAllowIdChange()
Defaults to return true, allowing object Id properties to be changed. Most DataSources that use foreign keys for references will not allow the object id to be changed after the object has been saved.

See Also:
OADataSourceJDBC#getAllowIdChange

getPropertyBlobValue

public abstract byte[] getPropertyBlobValue(OAObject obj,
                                            java.lang.String propertyName)
